intro: Cryptocarya pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, dark green, and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Cryptocarya pachyphylla is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in forested areas.
